=== Purchase Information ===
Product Title: Getting Into the Vortex: The Law of Attraction in Action, Episode XII
Review Date: 2010/11/29
Store: Esther Hicks  (Actor),     Jerry Hicks  (Actor, Director)    Rated:    PG    Format: DVD-ROM  This title is manufactured on demand using DVD-R, when sold by Amazon.com.  Learn more   What's this?
Categories: Movies & TV, Genre for Featured Categories, Special Interests
Product Description: ['Product Description', '2-DVD set', "“You didn’t come to ‘get it done'. You came for the thrill of the ride.”", 'New questions on\xa0: staying positive around a negative friend, why bad things can happen when you’re feeling good, death\xa0- of\xa0- a\xa0- child issues, she’s lost her trust in men, why are we all here, do we ultimately pay for harming others? And – how to hear your own Inner Voice!', 'Plus: Abraham issues a call-out to society:\xa0 “To the leaders of your world, to the leaders of your organizations, to the doctors and scientists and psychologists and psychiatrists, to the teachers… to anyone who wants to help anyone…”\xa0– Abraham delivers!', 'About the Actor', 'All your power is in your Now. And what Now is the reason that Now is Now its whole power and potential is that Now is where you meet You. It is where the vibration of your current offering and the vibration of You, meet. And your emotions tell you how the meeting is going.\xa0 For tons of free material along with the latest books, CDs,\xa0and DVDs, visit their website.']
Average Rating: 4.9
Product Details: {'Aspect Ratio': '1.33:1', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'PG (Parental Guidance Suggested)', 'Product Dimensions': '0.56 x 5.38 x 7.45 inches; 4 Ounces', 'Director': 'Jerry Hicks', 'Media Format': 'NTSC', 'Run time': '3 hours and 20 minutes', 'Release date': 'April 15, 2010', 'Actors': 'Esther Hicks, Jerry Hicks', 'Studio': 'Hay House', 'Number of discs': '2'}
Review Text: I enjoyed it very much. The meditations were great and I was able to do them easily. Very helpful. I hope Amazon gets more in soon, I have people I want to send it to.
Review Title: Great I loved it.
Rating: 5.0

raw_response:
SUMMARY:
The shopper demonstrates a strong affinity for classic films and series, particularly preferring older titles over newer adaptations. They consistently rate fantastic quality (average ratings mostly above 4.0) for enjoyable, humorous, or classic genres, indicating a preference for entertainment that evokes nostalgia and light-heartedness. The purchase patterns show significant enjoyment of science fiction and horror B-movies, suggesting an appreciation for campy or cult classics, while also being critical of modern productions they find lacking.

Quality and storytelling are paramount, as they favor well-crafted narratives and performances, often referencing acting and directing quality in their reviews. Price sensitivity appears moderate; while they gravitate towards the enjoyment of content, they also express disappointment when the quality doesn’t meet expectations, suggesting a willingness to engage with products at various price points as long as good quality is perceived.

Overall, core preferences manifest in a blend of humor, nostalgia, and appreciation for storytelling in older visual media, showing a consumer likely to prioritize past genres and formats over contemporary works, looking for both engagement and satisfaction in their viewing experiences.

target_interaction.title: good
target_interaction.text: A fairly good rendition of this Agatha Christie Classic. I've enjoyed  (I believe) all the various versions and this was a pretty good one.
